column5: Hey guys its been a while since i posted a report because ive been busy at school but with summer vacation in full swing im back on the water. Finished school last wednsday and since then went out for perch on simcoe twice and out for Pike once......All three days were non stop action ....I love the spring   The first day of perchin was great and we boated over 60 perch and atleast 25 of them were over 11inches ,the biggest being close to 14.  The second day of perchin the action was even better and close to a hundred in three hours and atleast fifty were over 10 inches, we caught a couple that were 13.  Went out yesterday for some pike. It was a beautiful day but a bit windy . The fish were biting thats for sure but i was rusty on the hook set. I went 8 for 14 on mr pike....OUCHHHH. my buddy andrew caught one pike and four huge bass hunting for the toothy criters......In total we boated 9 pike and six huge bass in the process. Dont wurry they were released boatside as they are out of season and on there beds. The biggest pike was 31 inches and we only caught one under twenty eight....not bad Me with a pike about eight pounds  Another one about the same size   It was a great couple days on the water and it will only get better as the water temps climb

congrats on the perch, but i hope you realize that pike season is still closed for another 9 days, assuming you were fishing Simcoe.  check your regs, or post where you were fishing, because pike is still closed in most parts of Ontario.
Here we go again  Tony
you have to read your regs ....lol .....pike opens on gbay May 1st....lol ....
He didn't say he went out on Simcoe for pike...and that sure doesn't look like Simcoe landscape....Hopefully I'm right. Pike is open on GBay!  Beat me snag...I knew you knew what you wuz doin.
hows about we don't ASSume.  Ontario's a big place.
sorry dude, you had mentioned Simcoe in the post and I misread it.  Just trying to keep the fishing legit know what i mean.  Nice pike though man.

good to see people getting out but  must say I read it twice because first time I thought it said perch and pike on Simcoe but after rereading I noticed that he really didn't say where he caught the pike, but rather had  perch simcoe and pike all in the same sentence....Like many speed readers and get it wrong if you don't go back and double check.........lol nothing like getting people going on a thurs.
Wow...what a great report...the colours on those fish were great!  Nice sized pike there!! Great job out there!
Nice job guys, looks like a perfect couple days to me.  Gonna have to get up that way sometime (never fished georgian bay).
nice job bro... !! i wish i skipped work ! !! im stuck hittin it up on the weekend
Nice fish AL, Gonna be fishin the trenton derby this week after that it spring kings at Port D. So free some next week.

lol .....thanks irishfield and raph...and ya i always check the regs...Honest missunderstanding steve...its all good.....simcoe is great but theres nothing like spring Gbay piken..... next trip this year im heading up to irishfields waters....its going to be tough but i love it up there. good luck and be safe on the water
When you goin...I'll be up there from the 14th to 25th of May.
Nice report!

hey irishfield ,im going up for the last week of may .....hows the walleye fishing in the spring....Ive heard its pretty rough but if you find them its great ......    good stuff iceguy ....hope you do great in the derby man .....if you need someone to hit delhooooos lol with next week man let me know
Nice report and WTG on those fish...
nice fish

I haven't had great luck YET. We'll be back home unfortunately when you'll be up there. Pickeral have spawned already on Lake Temagami and Cassels Lake...so they'll be out into deeper water by the time you get up there for sure. I'm hoping they are still holding close to the spawning areas when I get up..but cant' fish'm till the 19th unfortunately.
Here's a sample of some fish I caught this past week. http://video.google.ca/videoplay?docid=4847164986692447446
Nice catches man. I had to re-read the post as well. Good looking pike, what lures, structure, water temp? Thanks for sharing.
Looks like a good couple trips, good stuff...
Great report Snag and it sure sounds like you had some good action out there.
